messages.title: Danny standing up for families
messages.content: Danny Hackett standing up for families in Old Bexley & Sidcup. Danny works hard as a Labour Councillor on Bexley Council, speaking up for all residents.

messages.title: For the many, not the few
messages.content: On 8 June, families in Old Bexley & Sidcup can choose between a Labour government that stands up for the many, or the Tories who only look after a privileged few.

messages.title: Why I am backing Danny Hackett
messages.content: "I'm proud to back Danny Hackett as a strong local voice for Old Bexley & Sidcup. The Tories are holding our country back. Only Labour will build a Britain for the many." - David from Sidcup

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Protect living standards and create jobs
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Introduce a real living wage of £10 per hour and invest in infrastructure, skills and new technology.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Defend our NHS and tackle the care crisis
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Give the NHS and social care services the funding they need and join up services from hospital to home.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Give all children a chance to achieve their potential
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Provide universal free school meals for every primary school child and reduce class sizes.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Stand up for renters and help those locked out of home ownership
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Build one million new homes in five years and cap letting agency fees.

issues.education: Provide universal free school meals for every primary school child and reduce class sizes.
issues.health: Defend our NHS and tackle the care crisis. Give the NHS and social care services the funding they need and join up services from hospital to home.
issues.labourEmployment: Protect living standards and create jobs. Introduce a real living wage of £10 per hour and invest in infrastructure, skills and new technology.

community.content: Stand up for renters and help those locked out of home ownership. Build one million new homes in five years and cap letting agency fees.

leaflet.personalStatement: I'm proud to be the Labour candidate in this election. I believe people in Old Bexley & Sidcup deserve better than this Tory government – only a Labour government will stand up for you and your family.

contactInformation.address: Old Bexley & Sidcup CLP, 31 Sidcup Hill, Sidcup, DA14 6HJ

quotes.text: "I'm proud to back Danny Hackett as a strong local voice for Old Bexley & Sidcup. The Tories are holding our country back. Only Labour will build a Britain for the many."

images.caption: Danny Hackett standing up for families in Old Bexley & Sidcup.

examples: families are on average over £1,400 a year worse off
six million people earn less than the living wage
waiting lists have soared to around 3.8 million
a vote for Labour on 8 June is a vote for a country run for the many, not the few
The Tories only stand up for the privileged few
Our NHS can't take 5 more years of the Tories
The Tories can't fix Britain's housing crisis
Danny Hackett standing up for families in Old Bexley & Sidcup
Danny works hard as a Labour Councillor on Bexley Council, speaking up for all residents.
Introduce a real living wage of £10 per hour and invest in infrastructure, skills and new technology.
Give the NHS and social care services the funding they need and join up services from hospital to home.
Build one million new homes in five years and cap letting agency fees.
